text.cell:
In Challenge and Campaign mode the Whitetip reef shark will be available when your zoo has reached 0.5 stars.
The Whitetip reef shark (Triaenodon obesus) is a fish from the family of predator fish (Carcharhinidae), order ground sharks (Carcharhiniformes), that lives in the Pacific and Indian Ocean.
The Whitetip reef shark can reach a length of 213 cm. and live for about 25 years. It has a streched form. The mouth is at the bottom of its head. It has no sideline, but it has 2 dorsal fins and no bottom fin. The point of the first dorsal fin and the caudal fin are white. The shark swims woth snake movements trough the water.
The Whitetip reef shark is a salt water fish that lives in a tropical climate. This species can be found in seas, caves, waters with hard ground and coral reefs. The depth is about 1 to 330 m. under the surface. The shark hunts during the night. With its lean and snake like body, it can go into narrow spaces to find its prey. During the day it rests on sandy grounds of the reefs or in caves, where they gather.
It feeds on fish, by hunting small fish (it is a predator fish)
The Whitetip reef shark is not that important for commercial fishing, but it is for fun fishers. It can be seen in some aquaria. Ususally its a shy shark and is not interested in humans. But the Whitetip reef shark is dangerous to humans: it can hurt humans.
